comments.body: why is this check_bool_indexer when in all the others its check_bool_array_indexer?  found this bc mypy is complaining about that the first arg should be an Index
Opened https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/issues/34456 for this (and added link in the comment)

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +1066,1070 @@        # TODO copy=False is broken for astype_nansafe with int -> float, so cannot
        # passthrough copy keyword: https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/issues/34456
        sp_values = astype_nansafe(self.sp_values, subtype, copy=True)
        if sp_values is self.sp_values and copy:
            sp_values = sp_values.copy()

comments.body:
the default is 'integer'

https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/blob/fe1ea14910c9afec638114fce12308cdf26784dd/pandas/core/arrays/sparse/array.py#L277-L286

and is passed onto `make_sparse` (where the default is 'block')

https://github.com/pandas-dev/pandas/blob/fe1ea14910c9afec638114fce12308cdf26784dd/pandas/core/arrays/sparse/array.py#L1513-L1528

diffHunk:
@@ -1,1 +235,239 @@           is not a ``SparseDtype`` and `data` is a ``SparseArray``.

    kind : {'integer', 'block'}, default 'integer'
        The type of storage for sparse locations.

comments.body: this is nice but it may have changed the semantics
